name: Linux System Meta Features
description: The Linux System Meta Features parent feature encompasses a set of major sub-features necessary for providing package support, functionality, and development capabilities across various Linux product variants, graphical environments, and use cases. These sub-features include mandatory packages for specific product types such as Atomic Host, Workstation, Client, Server, and ComputeNode, as well as support for ostree functionality, design tools, graphical development environments, and conflict resolution for package installations. Additionally, this feature provides targeted solutions for developers working with GNOME, KDE, X Window System, LibreOffice, and legacy or advanced font requirements, making it a comprehensive suite for Linux configuration and extension.

name: Comprehensive Systems Management and Infrastructure Tools
description: A unified set of capabilities covering system backup, network management, identity and access control, debugging, performance analysis, high availability, storage solutions, cloud infrastructure, security tools, and advanced system management. This feature encompasses a diverse range of tools and services designed to manage physical and virtual environments effectively, facilitate infrastructure scalability, and ensure system reliability, security, and performance. The suite supports both graphical and command-line interfaces, making it suitable for various environments, including cloud, enterprise, and data center infrastructures.

name: Linux Desktop Environments and Applications
description: This parent feature encompasses a variety of desktop environments, window managers, and their associated applications, tools, and functionalities to provide a comprehensive graphical user interface experience for Linux systems. It includes lightweight, feature-rich, and traditional desktop environments, application suites tailored for these environments, multimedia and office productivity tools, as well as advanced tiling window managers for power users. It also covers legacy compatibility for X Window System and additional supplemental packages to enhance user experience.
children: Extra games for the GNOME Desktop
Extra plugins for the Xfce panel

name: Development and Authoring Toolkit
description: A comprehensive collection of tools, libraries, and environments to support software development, document authoring, educational applications, compatibility libraries, and platform-specific development. This parent feature encompasses a variety of programming languages, frameworks, and utilities to empower developers, educators, and authors with a robust toolkit for their needs. It also provides compatibility for legacy systems and diverse internationalization support, making it a well-rounded solution for Linux-based development and publishing.

name: Cloud and Virtualization Management Suite
description: An integrated feature encompassing tools, software, and utilities designed to create, manage, and optimize virtualization and cloud environments. This parent feature aggregates capabilities for boot management, container orchestration, cloud server administration, virtual machine drivers, hypervisor utilities, and platform-specific packages across major virtualization platforms (e.g., KVM, VMware, Hyper-V). Additionally, it supports both graphical and headless virtualization environments, as well as tools tailored for virtual guest management, including desktop and server agents. The suite also incorporates cloud and container management tools, such as Docker and Kubernetes toolkits, along with support for hybrid environments combining virtualization and containerization. This ensures comprehensive functionality for modern cloud and on-premises virtualized infrastructure needs.

name: Linux System and Environment Components
description: A comprehensive parent feature encompassing the essential building blocks, environments, critical paths, and specialized functionalities required for various Linux system configurations and use cases. This feature ensures modularity, flexibility, and support for diverse environments, from minimal installations to fully functional desktop and server editions.

name: Comprehensive System Feature Suite
description: This feature serves as a parent category encompassing a broad range of system tools, libraries, and applications designed to facilitate system administration, development, user productivity, and server functionality. It includes graphical and command-line tools for system management, software development, database management, multimedia creation, accessibility, internet applications, hardware support, network services, and mathematical or scientific computation. This suite ensures a diverse set of capabilities to cater to both general-purpose and specialized system needs, spanning desktop environments, server configurations, and engineering-specific tools.

name: Server and Application Hosting Solutions
description: This parent feature encompasses the necessary tools, software, and infrastructure required to enable a system to function as a server or application hosting platform. It includes features for database management, web hosting, e-mail services, file transfer protocols, print management, Java-based application execution, network storage support, and specialized services like 3D printing software. These capabilities provide comprehensive support for deploying and managing various server roles and application hosting environments.
